IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: PLAYWRIGHTS' CENTER SUSTAINS, DEVELOPS, AND ADVOCATES FOR PLAYWRIGHTS AND THEIR WORK TO REALIZE THEIR FULL ARTISTIC POTENTIAL.THROUGH THE PRACTICE OF INCLUSIVE THEATER-MAKING, PLAYWRIGHTS' CENTER FOSTERS ENGAGEMENT TOWARDS AN EQUITABLE, EMPATHETIC, AND BOUNDLESSLY IMAGINATIVE WORLD.
IRS990.MissionDesc: PLAYWRIGHTS' CENTER SUSTAINS, DEVELOPS, AND ADVOCATES FOR PLAYWRIGHTS AND THEIR WORK TO REALIZE THEIR FULL ARTISTIC POTENTIAL.
IRS990.Desc: FELLOWSHIPSMADE POSSIBLE BY THE MCKNIGHT, JEROME, AND TIDES FOUNDATIONS, FELLOWSHIPS PROVIDE MORE THAN $366,887 EACH YEAR FOR RESIDENCIES, COMMISSIONS, HEALTH ANV LIVING STIPENDS, AND DEVELOPMENT FUNDS. THROUGH THESE FELLOWSHIPS, THE PLAYWRIGHTS' CENTER FUNCTIONS AS A HOME FOR : TWO MINNESOTA-BASED MCKNIGHT FELLOWS IN PLAYWRITING: ONE NATIONALLY-BASED MCKNIGHT NATIONAL RESIDENCY AND COMMISSION FELLOW, THREE MCKNIGHT THEATER ARTIST FELLOWS, FOUR NATIONALLY-BASED JEROME FELLOWSHIPS FOR EMERGING PLAYWRIGHTS; TWO MANY VOICES FELLOWS OF COLOR (ONE MINNESOTA-BASED); TWO MINNESOTA-BASED MANY VOICES MENTEES, AND THREE VENTUROUS PLAYWRIGHT FELLOWS EACH RECEIVE AN AWARD OF $50,000 OVER TWO YEARS, AS WELL AS A PRODUCTION SUBSIDY GRANT OF UP TO $50,000 TO SUPPORT A PRODUCTION OF THE PLAY AT A THEATER OF THE PLAYWRIGHT'S CHOOSING. THROUGHOUT THEIR TWO-YEAR FELLOWSHIPS, THE PLAYWRIGHTS ARE IN RESIDENCE AT THE PLAYWRIGHTS' CENTER WHERE THEY HAVE ACCESS TO AN INDIVIDUALLY-TAILORED LINEUP OF NEW PLAY DEVELOPMENT AND ADVOCACY RESOURCES.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: CORE WRITER PROGRAMTHE CORE WRITER PROGRAM GIVES 25-30 PLAYWRIGHTS FROM ACROSS THE COUNTRY THE TIME AND TOOLS TO DEVELOP NEW WORKS FOR THE STAGE. ALL CORE WRITERS RECEIVE PLAY DEVELOPMENT WORKSHOPS AT THE CENTER IN COLLABORATION WITH PROMINENT DIRECTORS, ACTORS, DRAMATURGS, AND DESIGNERS. SELECTED WORK BY CORE WRITERS MAKES UP THE FORMAL SEASON OF PUBLIC READINGS: THE ANNUAL PLAYLABS FESTIVAL AND RUTH EASTON NEW PLAY SERIES. THE CENTER ALSO PROMOTES CORE WRITERS AND GIVES THEM OPPORTUNITIES TO CONNECT WITH PRODUCING THEATERS, COLLEGES, AND UNIVERSITIES THROUGH THE REGULARS AND NEW PLAYS ON CAMPUS PROGRAMS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: MEMBERSHIPMEMBERSHIP IS OPEN TO ALL AND PROVIDES MORE THAN 2,500 PLAYWRIGHTS WORLDWIDE WITH TOOLS, RESOURCES, AND SUPPORT. BENEFITS INCLUDE A DATABASE OF PLAYWRITING OPPORTUNITIES, ONLINE AND IN-PERSON CLASSES AND SEMINARS, ACCESS TO READINGS WITH PROFESSIONAL ACTORS, DRAMATURGICAL SERVICES, AND MORE. IN ADDITION, THE PLAYWRIGHTS' CENTER'S NEW PLAYS ON CAMPUS PROGRAM SERVES DOZENS OF COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES NATIONWIDE, PROVIDING SCRIPT-MATCHING SERVICES, ARRANGING PLAYWRIGHT RESIDENCIES, AND OFFERING IMMERSIVE APPRENTICESHIPS TO STUDENT PLAYWRIGHTS.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE A, PART II, LINE 10, EXPLANATION OF OTHER INCOME:

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: LOBBY EFFORTS TO SUPPORT CAPITAL CAMPAIGN TO PURCHASE BUILDING AND RE-CONSTRUCTION.

INCOME TAX THE PLAYWRIGHTS' CENTER HAS A TAX-EXEMPT STATUS UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE AND HAS ADOPTED ACCOUNTING FOR UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES, ASC 740-10. THE ORGANIZATIONS POLICY IS TO EVALUATE UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS, AT LEAST ANNUALLY, FOR THE POTENTIAL FOR INCOME TAX EXPOSURE FROM UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME OR FROM LOSS OF NONPROFIT STATUS. THE ORGANIZATION CONTINUES TO OPERATE CONSISTENT WITH ITS ORIGINAL EXEMPTION APPLICATION AND EACH YEAR TAKES THE NECESSARY ACTIONS TO MAINTAIN ITS EXEMPT STATUS. IT HAS BEEN CLASSIFIED AS AN ORGANIZATION THAT IS NOT A PRIVATE FOUNDATION UNDER THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE AND CHARITABLE CONTRIBUTIONS BY DONORS ARE TAX DEDUCTIBLE. IN COMPLIANCE WITH ITS EXEMPT STATUS, THE ORGANIZATION ANNUALLY FILES A RETURN OF ORGANIZATION EXEMPT FROM INCOME TAX (FORM 990). THE RETURNS FOR THE YEARS ENDING JUNE 30, 2010 AND LATER REMAIN SUBJECT TO EXAMINATION BY THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE.

DUE TO COVID RESTRICTIONS PWC STAFF CONTINUED TO PERFORM ONLINE ZOOM PROGRAMMING TO LIMIT OR DELAY PROGRAM SERVICES. ORGANIZATION IS SLOWLY TRANSITIONING TO ON-SITE PROGRAMMING WITHIN RECOMMENDED STANDARDS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: LINE 6 EXPLANATION - MEMBERS PAY $75/ANNUALLY OR $8/MONTHLY FOR ACCESS TO PLAYWRITING TOOLS AND RESOURCES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: LINE 11B EXPLANATION - THE FINANCE COMMITTEE REVIEWS THE 990 AND RECOMMENDS APPROVAL OF THE FILING TO THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE REVIEWS AND DISCUSSES THE FILING IN OCTOBER OR NOVEMBER, AND UPON APPROVAL SENDS IT ON TO THE FULL BOARD OF DIRECTORS FOR REVIEW AND FORMAL APPROVAL. THE FULL BOARD OF DIRECTORS APPROVES THE OFFICIAL FILING OF THE FORM AT A MEETING OF THE BOARD IN NOVEMBER.

GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY ARE MADE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST. ANNUAL FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE PUBLISHED IN THE CENTER'S ANNUAL REPORT AND ON GUIDESTAR, AND ARE REGISTERED WITH THE CHARITY REVIEW COUNCIL.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: KEY EMPLOYEES NEED TO OBTAIN APPROVAL FROM THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE FOR OUTSIDE CONSULTING ACTIVITIES; THE PRODUCING ARTISTIC DIRECTOR AND MANAGING DIRECTOR MONITOR THE DECISIONS AND TRANSACTIONS RELATIVE TO CONFLICTS AND RAISE THEM WITH THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE WHEN ANY CONCERN ARISES. PERIODICALLY THE ORGANIZATION OBTAINS MULTIPLE BIDS FROM VENDORS FOR WHICH CONFLICTS MAY ARISE TO CONFIRM THAT THE RATES FOR IN-KIND OR PURCHASED WORK IS COMPETITIVE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: 1. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE PWC BOARD OF DIRECTORS IS RESPONSIBLE FOR REVIEWING COMPARABLE MARKET DATA AND RECOMMENDING SALARY LEVELS FOR THE EXECUTIVE POSITIONS - MANAGING DIRECTOR AND PRODUCING ARTISTIC DIRECTOR - THAT REPORT TO THE BOARD. THE COMMITTEES REVIEW AND RECOMMENDATIONS ARE PRESENTED ANNUALLY TO THE FULL BOARD FOR APPROVAL. 2. THE PWC PARTICIPATES IN TWO SURVEYS: THE THEATRE COMMUNICATIONS GROUP SURVEY AND THE MN COUNCIL OF NON-PROFITS SURVEY AND REVIEWS COMPARABLE DATA BASED ON ANNUAL OPERATING BUDGET; GEOGRAPHIC LOCATION; AND ACTIVITY/MISSION AREA/FOCUS. OUR SCOPE FOR EXECUTIVE POSITIONS IS NATIONAL (THEATRE COMMUNICATIONS GROUP); MN AND TWIN CITIES (MN COUNCIL OF NONPROFITS). FOR THE PRODUCING ARTISTIC DIRECTOR POSITION, SALARY DATA FROM COMPARABLE JOBS AT FIVE NATIONAL ORGANIZATIONS AS REPORTED ON IRS FORM 990 IS INCLUDED IN THE MARKET ANALYSIS. 3. THE PWC MAINTAINS MINUTES OF BOARD PROCEEDINGS IN THE REVIEW AND APPROVAL OF DIRECTOR COMPENSATION ACCOMPANIED BY MATERIALS THAT DETAIL THE ORGANIZATIONS COMPENSATION PHILOSOPHY AND STRATEGY. THE MINUTES INCLUDE: TERMS OF THE DECISION AND THE DATE IT WAS APPROVED; MEMBERS OF THE BOARD WHO WERE PRESENT AND A RECORD OF THE VOTES THAT WERE CAST APPROVING RECOMMENDED ACTION(S); DETAILS OF THE DATA: HOW IT WAS OBTAINED AND USED TO FORMULATE THE RECOMMENDED ACTION(S); DOCUMENTATION THAT BOARD MEMBERS WITH ANY CONFLICT OF INTEREST ABSTAINED FROM VOTING ON THE ACTION(S).

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY ARE MADE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST. ANNUAL FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE PUBLISHED IN THE CENTER'S ANNUAL REPORT AND ON GUIDESTAR, AND ARE REGISTERED WITH THE CHARITY REVIEW COUNCIL.
